name: Sirdemo
body:
### What's here?
This is a demo program i put together in 2008 for a university exam on image generation and synthesis.
It uses OpenGL fragment shaders to generate a SIRD (Single-Image Random Dots) stereogram of a moving object on screen.
[SPOILER: It's a teapot, what were you expecting?]

### Features - What can it do?
It displays pretty images on screen.
You can't change the window size, you can't load 3-D models and sometimes you can't even close the window because the event handling code is very poor.
Again, it's a demo so it served its purpose and nothing more ;)

### Why is it here?
Pretty much only to try the GitHub platform, since i don't plan to update the demo soon

### Authors and Contributors
I (@AlexNava) did the program and the shaders, there are no other contributions at the moment.
